definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: He was a school teacher, a Brahmin, with a clean dhoti.
sentences.chinese: 他是個學校老師，一個婆羅門人，裹着乾淨的腰布。

sentences.english: A procession of Brahmins is coming this way.
sentences.chinese: 婆羅門僧侶的遊行隊伍向咱們這兒來了。

sentences.english: At that time, a high Bhraman in this assembly whose name was No-dirt and Subtle Light. He was a wise man of profound knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 爾時衆中有一大婆羅門名無垢妙光多聞聰慧人所樂見。

sentences.english: It was also my service to place a new Brahmana thread on his desk every month.
sentences.chinese: 每個月在他的桌上放一條新婆羅門聖線也是我的服務。

sentences.english: This Bhraman No-dirt and Subtle light stood from his seat.
sentences.chinese: 時婆羅門無垢妙光從座而起。

sentences.english: The highest varna is the Brahmin , the priests and scholars .
sentences.chinese: 最高瓦爾納是婆羅門，牧師和學者。

sentences.english: A Brahmanic revival appears to have occurred with the fall of the Mauryas.
sentences.chinese: 婆羅門教的復興是出現在孔雀王朝沒落的時期。

sentences.english: Udaya filled the Blessed One's bowl with rice.
sentences.chinese: 三時，優陀耶婆羅門，以白飯盛滿世尊之鉢。

sentences.english: The absolutely real, Brahman, is eternal.
sentences.chinese: 絕對真實的，婆羅門，是永恆的。

sentences.english: In past centuries, Brahmins have been the primary practitioners of Jyotish.
sentences.chinese: 在已往數世紀，婆羅門是首要的周諦士在業者。

sentences.english: I am really that Brahman which is my eternal nature.
sentences.chinese: 我真的認爲這是我的婆羅門永恆的性質。

sentences.english: He spoke against the caste system which angered the Brahmins .
sentences.chinese: 他談到對種姓制度激怒了婆羅門。

sentences.english: Brahmanism and Mahayana have passed a long process of mixture and interfusion.
sentences.chinese: 婆羅門教與大乘佛教經過了長期融和的過程。

sentences.english: He lived at Baranagore and was the son of a brahmin pundit.
sentences.chinese: 他住在巴拉納戈爾，是一位婆羅門學者的兒子。

sentences.english: The guru explains to the students the teachings of vedanta and what is Brahman.
sentences.chinese: 該專家解釋對學生的教誨，韋丹塔，什麼是婆羅門。

sentences.english: The Brahmin Udaya filled the Blessed One's bowl with rice.
sentences.chinese: 三時，優陀耶婆羅門，以白飯盛滿世尊之鉢。

definition: to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
monk (Sanskrit: Sramana, originally refers to north India)/Buddhist monk
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]
